summary: This is a transcript of a press conference by US Attorney Geoff Berman announcing the unsealing of sex trafficking charges against Jeffrey Epstein. The charges allege Epstein sexually abused dozens of underage girls from at least 2002 to 2005 at his properties in New York and Florida, paying them cash and creating a network of victims. Epstein was arrested upon arrival at Teterboro Airport from Paris.

persons.name: Geoff Berman
persons.role: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the speaker at the press conference, announcing the charges against Jeffrey Epstein and outlining the allegations. He states his office will seek Epstein's detention pending trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is charged with conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking of underage girls. The allegations state he abused dozens of victims, some as young as 14, at his New York and Florida properties from at least 2002 to 2005.

connections.description: Berman, as the US Attorney, is announcing the criminal charges brought by his office against Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking Period
events.description: Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused dozens of underage girls, paying them cash and using some victims to recruit others, at his New York City mansion and Palm Beach, Florida estate.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport aboard his private jet after it landed from Paris, France. He was taken to the Metropolitan Correctional Center in NYC.

events.title: Unsealing of Indictment and Press Conference
events.description: US Attorney Geoff Berman announces the unsealing of a two-count indictment against Epstein for conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking of underage girls.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking of underage girls.
The alleged abuse occurred from at least 2002 to 2005 at Epstein's properties in New York City and Palm Beach, Florida, involving dozens of victims as young as 14.
Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport upon arrival from Paris on a private jet.
The prosecution alleges Epstein paid victims in cash and used some victims to recruit additional underage girls, creating an expanding network.
The US Attorney's Office stated it would seek Epstein's detention pending trial.
